meanings.definition: To have lost or misplaced something.
meanings.sent1: I mislain my keys this morning and couldn't find them.
meanings.sent2: She always mislains her phone and then panics.
meanings.sent3: The cat mislained its favorite toy under the couch again.
meanings.sent4: The mislained map led them in circles for hours.
meanings.sent5: Don't mislain your homework if you want to get a good grade.

meanings.sent1: The mislain book was finally found on the bookshelf.
meanings.sent2: He felt frustrated when his mislain jacket couldn't be located.
meanings.sent3: The mislain sock turned up in the oddest place - the fridge!
meanings.sent4: Her mislain umbrella left her soaked in the sudden rain.
meanings.sent5: The mislain keys caused a delay in leaving for the trip.
